name: azuma
normalized: ahaa～～ haa… bogueeh… …
azuma slowly walked into the dormitory's dining hall while groaning, entirely like a zombie.
she had her head in her hands and her face was lacking her usual spirit, making her seem like a monstrous zombie who had just crawled out of the grave.

it was quite apparent that she was in poor health, however, it seemed like she couldn't remember the fact that i had planted the bug inside her last night, nor that i had injected a large amount of aphrodisiac into her, before raping her thoroughly.

name: kitae
normalized: a very good morning to you.
no wonder you are like this, after how much you had to drink last night.

name: azuma
normalized: morning… ouch… director… please refrain yourself from berating me first thing in the morning…

name: yamakawa
normalized: a very good morning to you, professor kamimura.
alright, here you are.

name: azuma
normalized: uhyaa!
you saved me, professor!
gokyugokyugokyugokyuun!
puhaa!
aah… i feel a bit more alive noow…
she emptied the glass of water that i had handed to her, by gulping it down in one swoop, as if she was chugging on beer, before spewing a breath out of her mouth, like a middle-aged geezer.

name: cara
normalized: azuma, these are the symptoms of a hangover, aren't they?
even though cara had kept azuma company last night as well, she looked pretty relaxed while enjoying an after-meal coffee.

name: azuma
normalized: uhahaa… miss queen, you may have had a lot to drink but it was a foul… after all, you're an actual monster, aren't you…?

name: marika
normalized: how rude.
you stink of alcohol, human.

name: azuma
normalized: shut your face!
it's a human privilege to become drunk and even have a hangover!

name: marika
normalized: what fragile creatures.

name: azuma
normalized: what did you saay!?
do you want to see how fragile we really are!?

name: marika
normalized: don't get ahead of yourself, human.
the hunter leaned forward, after having flown into a rage, and the knight, in turn, entered her combat stance calmly, as if to protect her mistress.

name: azuma
normalized: you're full of confidence, aren't you?
let's settle it right away then!
she readied her weapon, the metal bat known as the demon slayer, which was flowing with her spiritual energy and had been used to bury countless vampires until now.

name: marika
normalized: come at me anytime, if you are so desperate to die.
the most powerful knight in vlad transformed her own flesh into the murderous chainsaw of death, shiva, and her eyes started shining ominously.

name: kitae
normalized: alright, stop it, both of you.
save your strength for the classes.

name: azuma
normalized: hmph… you had a narrow escape from death there.

name: marika
normalized: that would be my line.
both of them, who were about to have a volatile confrontation, withdrew their weapons and turned their backs to each other.
alright.
that was really good, kitae.
i signalled kitae with a quick glance, as if to say that she had done well to stop them from going at each other, by intervening quickly.

name: kitae
normalized: mm… ahaa…
as soon as the barrier-master noticed that, the expression on her face melted away and she let a hot sigh leak out of her mouth.
i was pleased with kitae for having realized it as well.
however, the hunter and the assassin, being as they were, were bound to have plenty of such confrontations in the future.
how should i deal with it?
the bug was extremely vulnerable to external shocks dealt by spiritual or magical powers.
if she ended up confronting marika, as she had done now, and was even grazed by one of her attacks, then the bug would die.
if that did happen, then all of azuma's memories would be restored.
that would mean the failure of my plan, which would directly result in my death.
moreover, there was the risk of azuma being exposed to the aura of the students as well, as she was in charge of combat training.
it couldn't hurt to keep a close eye on her.
i decided to notify kitae, as well as my collaborator on this side, to the same.
in my opinion, the hunter and the assassin were merely competing with each other.
even when it came to combat training, i couldn't think of kamimura the hunter taking the students lightly whatsoever.
either way, it would be wise of me to not do anything about it, considering the fact that there was always the risk of being noticed by her, due to her intuition.
